programme.desc: Dr. Jeff tackles surgery he's never done before to save a pit bull puppy that can't eat on his own. A young woman's cat is rushed to the clinic with a mysterious injury. Dr. Jeff treats a young Lab who has stopped eating.(n)

programme.title: Too Cute!

programme.title: My Cat From Hell

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.sub-title: A Polar Bear in the City

programme.title: Treehouse Masters

programme.title: Tanked!
programme.desc: A tank is made that pays respects to the heroes that helped the area during the recent wildfires.(n)

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees
programme.desc: A former volunteer return in hopes of adopting a dog she fell in love with but her boxer threatens her chances. A parolee risks his freedom when he goes down the wrong path after being released from prison.(n)

programme.title: River Monsters

programme.title: River Monsters

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Wade seeks the notorious flesh eaters of the Amazon, including a fish that can swallow a man whole.(n)

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Rare silvery gibbons Alven and Tilu are expecting a new addition. But when the new baby arrives, it's up to Dad, Alven, to keep their older son, reckless teenager, Eko, in check.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Humboldt penguins Almond and Walnut go house hunting, but an intruder is eyeing up their turf.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Matriarch giraffe Dagmar is ready to give birth after a 15-month pregnancy. An orangutan family who was spared when fire ripped through their habitat attempts to resume normal life, while zookeepers try to wrangle a rogue macaw who flew the coop.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Zookeepers send an SOS to the vet when members of their large otter family develop bald patches. A pair of young flamingos may have their bromance split up by an injury, while elephant Anjan mourns the loss of his siblings and acts out for attention.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Matriarch giraffe Dagmar helps prepare her sister Orla for an overdue birth. Tragopan pheasant Wendy is a mom-to-be but struggles to incubate her eggs, while spider monkey Faye prepares to give birth again after losing offspring in years past.(n)

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: A popular sea lion falls ill after ingesting a foreign object. The avian team devises a plan to increase the cock-of-the-rocks population. Endangered snakes are coupled for breeding, and Andean bear cubs meet their fans.(n)

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: The zoo anxiously awaits the arrival of a snow leopard called K2's fourth cub. The staff is pleased when a pair of Andean condors embrace their new enclosure, while a squirmy binturong fights his annual vaccination.(n)

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: Two sickly newborn fawns form an unbreakable bond while they are hand-reared by staff. Leopard Khazo gets a surprise that enhances her life, and tensions run high as the reptile staff attempts to collect blood from Cuban crocs.(n)

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: Max the camel faces new challenges as he ages. The zoo prepares to give an injured turkey vulture a permanent home, but after healing, there may be a change of plan. Willow the red panda gives birth to two baby cubs.(n)

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: A rowdy, young markhor is injured and vets must treat his infected hoof. The TAB staff head to Manhattan to rescue a wallaby living in an apartment, while a fruit bat discovers how to spread her wings, and a trio of alligators move into their summer home.(n)

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: After more than 100 venomous snakes are taken from a private home, it's up to the zoo to care for them. Two Pronghorn fawns make their debut, but problems arise that have keepers concerned, while a device is built for a Red River hog needing a challenge.(n)

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: A trio of rare Dhole canines are prepared to make their cross-country journey to the zoo, and keepers anxiously await their arrival. A tinamou chick must be hand-reared, while a specialized tool is welded to extract a tusk from a charming Babirusa.(n)

programme.title: The Zoo: San Diego
programme.desc: Staff develop an innovative course of treatment when cheetah Amara shows signs of injury. The zoo becomes host to the only pair of platypuses outside Australia. And, a new team of falcon trainers show off their skills.(n)

programme.desc: The Rhino Rescue Center welcomes Arthur, the southern white rhino calf. A young nyala must be hand-raised before returning to its herd, koala joeys make a big move, and Connor the Malaysian tiger struggles with strange nosebleeds.(n)

programme.desc: High school volleyball player Jeanna Giese complains that she’s fatigued and has numbness in her arm.(n)

programme.title: Something's Killing Me
programme.desc: The CDC Disease Detectives investigate several emergency room patients with strange infections.(n)

programme.title: Something's Killing Me
programme.desc: A rare genetic disease causes fatal insomnia.(n)

programme.title: Something's Killing Me
programme.desc: Dr. Bill Lidner collapses just hours after returning home from a family trip overseas. His young daughters find him bleeding on the stairs of their Ohio home. They didn’t know it then, but it is the first sign that something is very wrong.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman attends evening church services... then disappears. Eyewitnesses place her at a nearby gas station, getting into a van. Three days later when her body is discovered, the search for the driver of that van intensifies.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a nine-year-old girl goes missing, police and volunteers spend weeks searching for her. A psychic’s vision leads to a field where her body is discovered, along with what investigators hope is enough evidence to help them to also find her killer.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Security camera video shows that what appears to be a casual encounter is actually a forced abduction, leading to murder. The perpetrator’s MO is remarkably similar to another murder which occurred five months earlier only 15 miles away.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is assaulted and stabbed nearly 30 times by an unknown assailant. Within days police hone in on a suspect who all but admits to the crime. As the trial approaches, DNA test results stun prosecutors and the suspect is released.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Northern Kentucky businessman is shot to death at his home in front of his wife. Police launch a massive manhunt to find the culprit, but their efforts were futile. A baseball bat and forensic investigation break the case wide open.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A family vacation turns tragic when a family matriarch suffers a tragic fall to her death. The circumstances surround the fall lead the investigators to think foul play was involved. Findings from a pathologist confirm their doubts.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman disappears without a trace and it appears that she was either kidnapped or murdered. Police concern heightens when they learn that two other women have vanished under similar circumstances.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Hikers discovered a body wrapped in sheets which were edged in orange stitching. Authorities hydrated the fingers and obtained a fingerprint, enabling them to identify the victim. They also discovered a tuft of red carpet fibers on the sheets.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A house erupts into flames on a winter night, killing one person and injuring another. The survivor blamed a kerosene heater for the fire, but the evidence did not match her story.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1957 the police search for a man who committed several crimes in one night, including murder. Eventually, the case turned cold. Almost fifty years later, with the help of scientific advances, the investigators find their man.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An eccentric millionaire who flaunted his wealth is found murdered.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police fear a missing woman is the latest victim in a string of similar crimes.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A victim's autopsy turns an investigation into a landmark forensics case: the device intended to save his life proved to be the only witness to his death.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A wealthy socialite died after falling down stairs, but was it an accident or was it murder? The laws of physics and an accident reconstructionist provided the answer.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young college student is found strangled and badly burned. Investigators get a break when a trace evidence expert uncovers the murder weapon in the spool of a vacuum.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a man dies with no proof of foul play, investigators learn that another man died the exact same way six years earlier. The men had one thing in common: at the time of their deaths, they were married to the same woman.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The victim had ingested a massive amount of cyanide. An unlikely clue, a flaw on a mailing envelope, exposed a murderer who was willing to kill innocent people to get the one person he wanted.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A tiny clue, no bigger than a thumbtack, held all the information investigators needed to put a trio of cold-blooded killers behind bars.(n)

programme.desc: A daily dose of news, weather, sports, entertainment, finance and travel, in a fast paced, approachable style.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a young reporter is murdered in her apartment, and the two suspects are cleared of any wrongdoing, police must turn to a databank of well over 8000 felons to catch the killer, leading to the first conviction in the U.S, based on this evidence.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police must investigate one of their own when a detective says his wife shot herself in the head. While he claims he called 911 as soon as he could, evidence makes police doubt the detective's story.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a prominent criminal defence attorney is found murdered in his own home, police suspect it may have come at the hands of one of his questionable clientele.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is convinced her husband is innocent of murder and conducted her own investigation to prove it.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When two women are murdered in a state park, Indiana police suspected a serial killer, until they looked at the evidence more deeply and were brought in totally different directions.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a woman's charred remains are found in the rubble of a burned house, investigators have to determine if it is an unfortunate accident, or arson and murder.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman's disappearance is tracked by a casino's security cameras. Investigators collect enough evidence left behind from the victim to inform them of who was responsible and how she disappeared.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In possibly the strangest case in the history of forensic science, investigators must solve a murder case with a list of evidence consisting entirely of a single squashed tomato left at the crime scene, and tiny reflections of light in a photograph.(n)

programme.title: Lies, Crimes and Video
programme.desc: 8-year-old Cherish Perrywinkle is lured out of a Walmart by a registered sex offender, but that’s just the beginning of a night of terror, all caught on camera.(n)

programme.title: Lies, Crimes and Video
programme.desc: Prominent realtor Todd Kohlhepp’s double life is exposed when police launch a dramatic rescue – all caught on body camera – of a young woman chained like a dog inside a shipping container on his property.(n)

programme.title: Lies, Crimes and Video
programme.desc: Shayna Hubers and Ryan Poston seemed like a match made in heaven, until he ends up dead in a pool of blood, shot in the face. Stunning interrogation tapes leave cops in disbelief and lead investigators to a surprising motive.(n)

programme.title: Lies, Crimes and Video
programme.desc: A mysterious tip leads police in Moore, Oklahoma to the Super 8 hotel. Inside Room 120, they find a missing teenage boy, a box of condoms, lotion, and a married state senator.(n)

programme.title: Sex and Murder: After Dark
programme.desc: Former model, Samira Frasch, was living a life of extravagance until tragedy struck. The mother of two was found dead at the bottom of her swimming pool and both her children missing from the home.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Profiles of intriguing crimes, accidents and outbreaks of disease from around the world are examined.(n)

programme.title: Sex and Murder: After Dark
programme.desc: Beautiful mom of two, Crystal McDowell, vanishes as Hurricane Harvey rocks Houston, Texas. Surveillance video leads investigators to her twisted killer.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Profiles of intriguing crimes, accidents and outbreaks of disease from around the world are examined.(n)

programme.title: Very Scary People
programme.desc: The unbelievable story of Robert Durst, the millionaire heir to a vast real estate fortune who has been linked to the deaths of his wife, his best friend, and his neighbor.(n)

programme.title: Very Scary People
programme.sub-title: Robert Durst: Nobody Tells the Whole Truth (Part 2)
programme.desc: Six weeks after jumping bail in Galveston, Texas, Robert Durst is caught on a store security camera in Pennsylvania shoplifting a sandwich and is quickly sent back to Galveston to stand trial for the murder of his neighbor, Morris Black.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Even though the victim was burned beyond recognition, police were able to create a composite sketch from his remains and identify him. Investigators still had to determine where he was killed, however, and who wanted him dead.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Doctors don't know why the young scientist is gravely ill. When tests finally reveal the cause, it's too late to save him. Police hope that lab analysis of his hair - showing when attempts were made on his life and what was used - will lead to the killer.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a dedicated, well-respected teacher disappeared, police had to determine if she'd gone on vacation without telling anyone, or if she was the victim of foul play. Investigators turned to forensic science, hoping to find the answers they needed.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When grunge singer Mia Zapata was gruesomely murdered, police were at a loss to track down her killer. But thanks to evidence collected by a forethoughtful medical examiner, police were able to catch the killer more than a decade after the fact.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Three bombings within a two-mile area were more than a coincidence, but no one claimed responsibility and no one in particular was targeted.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In the 20 years following an unsolved murder, lives changed and so did forensic science. In time, a high-powered microscope and DNA profiling revealed a clue no one had seen before.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a woman is shot to death in her driveway, police suspect a younger co-worker whose advances she spurned of killing her.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is found sexually assaulted and stabbed to death on a beach, a mere 10 yards from her hotel. Police use the tennis shoes left at the scene of the crime to find her killer.(n)

programme.title: Vengeance: Killer Millionaires
programme.desc: When an alarm goes off in an affluent Jupiter, Florida neighborhood, investigators must determine whether they're dealing with a suicide or something more sinister.(n)

programme.title: Vengeance: Killer Millionaires
programme.desc: Patrons are stunned when a man is gunned down at an Akron gas station, but investigators will be even more shocked when they uncover the four-way love affair behind the murder.(n)

programme.title: Vengeance: Killer Families
programme.desc: When an odor leads police to a mummified corpse in a Las Vegas storage unit, investigators are lead down a road of deceit, betrayal, and witchcraft.(n)

programme.title: Vengeance: Killer Families
programme.desc: When a torso is discovered floating in London's Regent's Canal, the family of a missing former actress fears the worst.(n)

programme.title: Real Life Nightmare
programme.desc: Russell Dermond’s headless body is discovered in the garage of his million-dollar lakefront mansion. His wife, Shirley, is found floating dead in the water, her ankles tethered with cinder blocks. One key piece of evidence still remains missing.(n)

programme.title: Real Life Nightmare
programme.desc: Rebecca Zahau seemed to have it all, until she’s found dead in a multi-million dollar mansion, hanging from a balcony under bizarre circumstances. Police ruled her death a suicide, but some aren’t buying it.(n)

programme.title: Real Life Nightmare
programme.desc: Lauren Spierer went for a night out with friends in June 2011. The college coed has never been seen since. But years later, the mystery deepens when another female student from the same university is found dead after another night on the town.(n)

programme.title: Real Life Nightmare
programme.desc: Newlyweds Jessica and Matthew Boynton seemed like the picture-perfect couple until the young mother is found unresponsive and covered in blood inside her locked bedroom closet, and doesn't remember how she ended up there.(n)

programme.title: Real Life Nightmare
programme.desc: College student Elisa Lam checks into a Los Angeles hotel, but never checks out. The last known images of the tourist are from the hotel’s elevator security camera. Nearly 2 weeks later, her naked body is found floating in the hotel's rooftop water tank.(n)

programme.title: Real Life Nightmare
programme.desc: Beautiful mom Michelle Parker appears on an episode of' The People’s Court', fighting with her ex-fiancé over a luxury, diamond engagement ring. But hours after that episode airs, Michelle mysteriously vanishes.(n)

programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Gainesville Murders (Part 1)

programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Gainesville Murders (Part 2)
programme.desc: After five murders it would take investigators months - and the discovery of a campsite, a screwdriver and an audio tape - before they identified who the serial killer was.(n)
